label: Description
value: In the center, two angels are supporting a tiara, behind them are crossed keys. Beside two panels, each to be decorated alike. On top a frieze with rinceaux. Two crossed festoons are supported above by an escutcheon, and at the sides by volutes having on top a cherub. Below is a bunch of leaves and fruits, with a flying bird.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, pen and sepia ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. The ride side is shown. Above an entablature are openings in a gallery, seen from below. They are framed by pilasters. At right sits a man writing in a book, possibly Saint Matthew. At center is a decorative vase. At center left, is the upper part of a figure, possibly Saint Lawrence. At far left is a framed picture of the Virgin and Child. Seen in the background, a vaulted ceiling.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, pen and ink, brush and bistre on paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: On top are three capitals connected by an entablature, with candles standing beside the capitals, except at the left, where the capital is on top of a column and the candlestick is farther from it. The entablature is decorated with festoons. Below the entablature is a frieze with two escutcheons beside a trophy of arms. Partially squared.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, pen and ink, brush and sepia on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Three panels framed by pilasters, with alternate variations. The central panel has in the middle a candelabrum with a burning fire above a leaf base, the lateral panels have a floral candelabrum upon a similar base with two flying birds breaking stems of the rinceaux protruding from the bases. Two festoons are suspended beside each of the candelabra. In front of the pilasters are two crossed branches, fastened by a knot whose ends are hanging into the panels.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, pen and sepia ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Three panels framed by oblongs with masks above and below, supporting festoons, whose other ends are supported in the lateral panels by masks above and below, and in the central panel by rinceaux. Inside the panels are smaller ones framed by bands, with an oval containing a shell, at left and right, and a motif of four shells in the center; rinceaux; half-figures of winged animals at left and right.

label: Physical description
value: Black crayon, pen and sepia ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle showing a row of satyr masks, from whose mouths flows streams of water in shell basins supported by acanthus leaves. Below the masks, a Romanesque arcade hung with festoons. On three sides, a band of floral ornament.

value: Graphite, pen and ink on paper

Recto: Battle between Pygmies and Cranes; Verso: inscription relating to Pliny the Elder's Natural History, Book 7, ch. 2

label: Description
value: The Pygmies are riding goats and sheep and battle with lances and bows. They attack from the right. the birds come from the left. In the right back Pygmies mounted and on foot flee. Verso: inscription referring to Pliny the Elder's account in the Natural History, book 8 chaper 26

label: Description
value: Two putti stand upon a console, one shown from the front, the other from the back. They support a painted ceiling beam. On either side are partial escutcheons composed of sculptural ornament including putti, a swan and a snake.

label: Credit line

Design for Various Decorations including "Coriolanus at the Walls of Rome"

label: Description
value: Left row, above: "Sacrificio alla Pace" (all captions are written above octagonal panels): putto blowing double flute; at right, an altar. Center: "Trionfo delle armi:"  putto with wreath running into chariot with panoply. Below: "segnifero Romano:" putto with legionary sign beside trophy. Central row, above: Coriolanus implored by women of Rome, rising from throne at right: "Coriolano alle mura di Roma." Center: left half of decoration is roughly sketched. In center is high shaft with bowl, Rinceaux spring from it, putti and boy are between them. Bottom: left octagon with putto blowing horn beside trophy of arms, right octagon with putto bringing wood to altar. Right row, above: hexagon with trophy and rinceaux; right row, below: putto carrying standard beside panoply.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and wash over black chalk on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; 1901: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
Chimney Pieces, Furniture and Ceiling Medallion

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Verso: two chimney pieces, part of the elevation of a sofa, a console table,  a wash stand, a klismos chair,  Recto: a bowl, lance and helmet, and medallions disposed in two rows;  in each is a walking or running putto. Above each medallion is written by Giani with ink, respectively: asta, elmo,   sc(u)do , spade.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink on laid paper

label: Provenance
value: Giovanni Piancastelli; Rome; 1901: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of various donors

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle framing an oval landscape. In the center, above, Leda with the swan after Michelangelo; at left, the eagle of Zeus received by a nude woman; at right, Cupid; below at left, a man with a goat; below center, a medallion with a female profile; below at right, Hercules with the Hydra. Two swans clasping garlands flank the main scene.

label: Description

Below are piled a variety of arms including spears and a battle axe. At bottom left, a ram’s head; at bottom right, a serpent’s head.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle.  The Apostle stands before a niche, thinking about what he will write next.  The Bull crouches behind him.  The left lower part of the coat shows the correction of a first design.  Verso:  "B," horizontally.  The bull runs towards left.  The putto flies beside him, holding his head.  Caption:  "A and scribbling/ a fare col vise fra le corne e con lemane sula fronte che/ il toro vede lume corendo."  Notes vertically, on top: "adi 18 dicembre bighest et fatken van/ 2 trellen tetrinken/ La di 14 di gennaio comencai a/ bere la bottade 4 borili e 1/2."
